data.text: @thereal_truther @AlSoto9 And the correct analogy would be in “absolute terms” vs. “relative terms”, since there have been “lots” of people negatively impacted, but “lots” is a small number relative to the number of lives saved.

@thereal_truther @AlSoto9 Well, airbags aren’t deployed preventively to prevent an accident. So a weak analogy. But lets roll with it. Google “airbag injuries”; u’ll be amazed how many grifting law firms, chiropractors, govt agencies, and that Uber-grifter known as IIHS, spend energy addressing this.
@neweagle @AlSoto9 That’s like saying in relative numbers lots have been negatively effected by air bags.

@thereal_truther @AlSoto9 Once again, both can be true, and are true.  The vaccines are incredibly safe. But like any other medical intervention, that is a statement based on relative numbers. In absolute numbers, “lots of people” have been very negatively impacted.

@neweagle @AlSoto9 Yeah no. 

It’s incredibly safe despite the propaganda. https://t.co/G5Xt3ZJWRf

@_ResearcherGirl @thereal_truther The worst part is that a lot of these people will attach themselves to other anti medicine panics as covid dies down. They won't just disappear as a societal force. Its already tied to things like 5g fear so hopping to another topic is easy.

@AlSoto9 *saved millions of lives. 

Corrected it for you!
@mac_an_ghoill Nope. He’s always been one of the worst and most ignorant Covid propagandists on twitter. Only the weak sheep still follow him. 🤷‍♂️
